items.title: Croatians cast their ballots in first round of presidential election
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
People in Croatia headed to the polls on Sunday to cast their ballots in the first round of the country's presidential election. The nation's left-leaning president, Zoran Milanović, an outspoken critic of Western military support for Ukraine in the war against Russia, is unlikely to get an outright majority in the first round of voting where he faces seven other contenders. (AP video shot by Sasa Kavic)

Subscribe: http://smarturl.it/AssociatedPress
Read more: https://apnews.com​

items.title: Photos of missing Syrians cover the historic monument of Marjeh Square in Damascus
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
Photos of missing Syrians cover the marble base of a bronze column in Damascus' Marjeh Square as relatives desperately search for information about their loved ones. At the base of the monument, hundreds of photos of missing people are labelled with mobile phone numbers of relatives, in case anyone has information. (AP video by Omar Albam)

Subscribe: http://smarturl.it/AssociatedPress
Read more: https://apnews.com​

This video may be available for archive licensing via https://newsroom.ap.org/home

items.title: Georgia's new President sworn in amid mass protests
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
Former soccer player Mikheil Kavelashvili was formally inaugurated president of Georgia on Sunday, as the ruling party tightened its grip in what the opposition calls a blow to the country’s EU aspirations and a victory for former imperial ruler Russia.

items.title: Emergency official says bird strike or weather may have caused South Korean plane crash
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
Lee Jeong-hyeon, chief of the Muan fire station, said workers were looking into various possibilities about what caused the crash, including whether the aircraft was struck by birds that caused mechanical problems. Read more here: https://bit.ly/3PjZJH6

items.title: LIVE: Plane fire at South Korea airport kills at least 120
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
A passenger plane burst into flames after it skid off a runway at a South Korean airport and slammed into a concrete fence when its front landing gear apparently failed to deploy, killing at least 120 people, officials said, in one of the country’s worst aviation disasters. Read more here: https://bit.ly/3PjZJH6

#southkorea #plane #live

items.title: Syria's dwindling Jewish community revisits synagogue heavily damaged in civil war
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
In a Damascus suburb, the head of Syria's tiny Jewish community visits the newly accessible Joba synagogue for the first time in 15 years. First built seven centuries before the birth of Christ, the synagogue once drew worshippers from across the region but was largely destroyed during the civil war. (AP Video/Omar Sanadiki)

#syria #religion #news

items.title: Plane bursts into flames after skidding off runway at South Korea airport, killing at least 167
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
A passenger plane burst into flames Sunday after it skid off a runway at a South Korean airport and slammed into a concrete fence when its front landing gear apparently failed to deploy, killing at least 167 people, officials said, in one of the country’s worst aviation disasters. Read more here: https://bit.ly/3PjZJH6

items.title: 15 hurt in Florida when train hits fire truck that drove onto tracks after another train passed
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
Three firefighters and a dozen passengers have been injured in Florida after a fire truck drove around the crossing arms into the path of a high-speed passenger train after waiting for a freight train to pass. Read more here: https://bit.ly/4gXfLml

#train #florida #news

items.title: Brazilians honor sea goddess and mark arrival of new year in Rio de Janeiro
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
Devotees of Afro-Brazilian religions gathered on Rio de Janeiro's storied Copacabana beach on Saturday to honor the sea goddess Yemanjá in a traditional New Year tribute. Clad in white robes, followers of the Candomble and Umbanda religions danced in a circle to the beat of traditional drums. (AP Video/Mario Lobao)

#brazil #riodejaneiro #newyear #news

items.title: Large waves wreak havoc on coastal communities and fisheries in Peru
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
Large waves continued to strike the coast of Peru on Saturday, wreaking havoc on communities, especially in the regions north of the capital, Lima. The large waves shocked fishermen in the Tumbes region as they prepared to go out to sea, with many seen running to escape the strong waves while others struggled to protect their boats. (AP video shot by: Juan Mandujano)

#peru #news 

Subscribe: http://smarturl.it/AssociatedPress
Read more: https://apnews.com​

This video may be available for archive licensing via https://newsroom.ap.org/home

items.title: Hong Kong holds first panda-themed drone show
items.author: Associated Press
items.content:
Hundreds gathered in Hong Kong on Saturday to watch the city’s first pyrotechnics drone show, as part of a campaign to raise support and awareness of panda conservation. The 10-minute drone show featured 1,000 drones, some of which were equipped with fireworks, flying over Hong Kong’s Victoria Harbour and forming images of the city’s giant pandas.

#hongkong #panda #drone

items.title: AP’s best photos of 2024
items.author: Associated Press
items.content: In nearly 100 countries and all 50 U.S. states, visual journalists with The Associated Press are eyewitnesses to the world’s news. This year, AP photographers captured 2024’s vast catalogue of events, from breaking news to intimate moments both quiet and exuberant. #shorts #AP #photography #EOY #2024
